newsitem.title: USA: N.J. school district sets vote on $2.65 mln bonds.
newsitem.headline: N.J. school district sets vote on $2.65 mln bonds.

text.p: Board of Education officials in Allendale, N.J., Monday night approved a resolution placing a $2.65 million school bond referendum before voters on Dec 12, a board official said Tuesday.
The bonds would pay for improvements to technology and physical education facilities at Northern Highlands Regional High School.
